reviews.review_msg: From the first day, Dr. O'Brien was lively and friendly. She encourages people to attend office hours, and the way her tutorial is structured to encourage everyone to participate. She doesn't demean, patronize, or scoff at any idea presented. She genuinely listens to your ideas, and elevates it, even if you struggle with making the point.

Absolutely loved Dr. O'Brien. Very clear with what she is looking for, supportive, caring, usually runs helpful workshops during office hours and is very flexible with setting up meetings outside of those times. I found the course fairly easy just because of how clear she is in her expectations, but be aware that there is still a lot to take in.
THE BEST!

Emily O'Brien is definitely one of the best profs in the history department, I have been struggling so much this semester but she took the time to meet with me several time as well as offer lots of advice over email to help me with and she is genuinely someone who wants to see her students succeed, she also bring an enthusiam for the material

Dr. O'Brien is a sweet heart who puts in all her effort to engage and put interest in course material but often is vague with her expectations. Expect to write a ton, especially during exams and know the "historical significance" of everything. Textbook was only useful for readings in tutorials. Overall good class but high expectations are set.
Hardest class I have taken but I learn a lot.

One of the nicest profs Ive ever met. Always available to help, and wants to see you succeed. Grades a little too tough based on the scope of the course (an elective), but makes classes fly by with engaging activities. Overall great prof.

Taking Prof. O'Brien's class was a real treat. She always made the 3.5-4hr lectures fly by with constant engagement and an open-forum-style lecture. Coming from a heavy science background, I can say that her class is the epitome of what I wish all of my electives were. Ask her for support when you need it and she will ALWAYS be willing to help.
Dry and boring. She is too focused on her own research.

Emily O'Brien is one of the best teachers I have had at SFU. She really engages the class and inspires enthusiasm in her class. She really knows her subject matter and is able to make everything interesting. One book required but it's cheap and also very interesting. Mandatory attendance at the tutorial but you won't want to miss it anyways!
If you don't like history, take it with Prof. O'Brien! she will change your mind. You may not get an A, but you will learn things that you will stick with you for the rest of your life.

Prof O'Brien is a prof who (1) knows TONS re: her area of expertise and beyond, (2) is VERY passionate about what she teaches, (3) unpacks the material with the class/individual amazingly, (4) is very precise in what she looks for in her assignments. Fantastic prof -- she makes you want to work hard and she'll definitely recognize it!

Emily is a professor I could listen to lecture all day. She has so much interesting information and I found this course informations wise great. While her lectures are super clear its pretty difficult to understand her grading and what she's looking for on tests. That said, I'd definetly take another class with her.

Took this for the B-HUM requirement. The course content was really tough and requires deep analysis. Seems like it'd be difficult to do well unless you have background in the subject area (which shouldn't be the case because it's a 100 level class). Emily tends to not get to the point and taking notes was hard.

I absolutely adore her! Great at relaying the information to you in lecture in a clear and flowing way. Try to get your tutorial with her if you can as she's great at keeping the discussion going. Very easy to approach with questions and concerns! She really helped me out when I went to her office hours! I would recommend her to anyone! Fav prof

Emily is brilliant, kind, keeps every session interesting. No easy As (this isn't the EDUC dept after all) but friends & I've taken several classes w/ her & always expected lower final grades than we got (A-). Pretty sure a discretionary mark is in play here: make it a rule to participate at least 3-5 times per class w/ enthusiasm & you'll be glad

Prof. O'Brien is by far one of the best professors in the SFU History Department. She is an incredibly engaging lecturer, supplementing her lectures with music and art. She is also very kind and approachable, always willing to give help to students who ask for it. As for her marking, she has high expectations. A's are attainable,  but require work.

Professor O'Brien was great! Her lectures are very organized & her tutorials cover the readings in detail. She gives very detailed feedback for midterms and papers (a whole page of feedback for a paper)! She is very enthusiastic and approachable! I would take a course with her again!

Super hard marker. I decided to take this course thinking it would be a fun B-Hum elective since I aced 101, but I was wrong... She expects too much for a first year course. I studied to the point where I had everything memorized and listened to her advice but I still got horrible marks on exams. I never want to take a humanities course ever again.

Great professor who will tank your GPA if you aren't careful and thorough. She's friendly, helpful, provides you with enormously detailed feedback on your essays and exams, but the amount of detailcriticism will probably make you feel really, really dumb, no matter how nicely she puts it.
absolutely wonderful, always willing to answer us, be it email or in person. She seemed like she cared, and tried to help her students pass. She gives amazing feedback too!

Amazing professor - my favorite at SFU. She is passionate about what she teaches, kind, helpful and tries hard to be available for her students outside of the classroom. If you are interested in the subject that she teaches, willing to work hard and you like talking in class, you will enjoy her classes.
Good

This prof definitely is very intelligent and interested in the material, but is a ruthless marker. no notes, just lectures of 3 hours straight returns essays with so much critique and writing it is insane. makes you feel quite unintelligent. i do not recommend taking a class with her unless u are HIGHLY interested in the material. Very hard marker

I'm a 4th year student, and she's hands down my favourite prof at SFU. She always comes to class prepared, and expects the same out of her students.  It's true, she is a harder marker than some, but you learn a lot in her class and she's always willing to set up an appointment if you need help with your paper.

The work load is alot, but actually kind of interesting to read and a breath of fresh air from calculus or stats. The key to success in her class is your ability to analyze. My main problem was summarizing the texts and not going deep enough into the true meaning of the material.

Prof O'Brien is very approachable and enthusiastic about her subject. However, she's definitely a hard marker, and often gives so much feedback on papers that instead of being helpful it ends up being useless and overwhelming. She's also very big on participation...so if you don't like talking in class, it's best to stay away!

One of the most clear and organized courses I've taken. Her lectures are succinct and very informative. Her assignments are fair; they aren't "easy" but they aren't too hard either. They simply require that you put some thought and effort into it. I never got lower than a A- so to those who say she is impossible its only your laziness or idiocy.
One of my favourite professors at SFU. Great lectures! She led our tutorial as well and it so good. Fair marker and fair tests. I never wanted to miss a class. Prof O'Brien is my favourite!

Great prof, expectations and grading were tough, but fair...very helpful, nice person, approachable outside of class. lots of work, but about right for 4 credits.  not easy class, but highly recommend it if you work hard.

nice & friendly prof, too much work, marks too hard, too much readings, i thought this course would be interesting and not too much work, but it turns out to be super crazy HARD and difficult. impossible to score a good grade on essay or midterms or final. wayyyy too muchh work and essays, it's crazy!

Emily is a friendly prof and seems passionate about teaching.  It's a shame that she has to be such a tough marker. The way she marked my papers seemed almost vindictive. This prof is often unclear about expectations. I was surprised to find a 2nd year history class to be so needlessly difficult.
Interesting subject. However, she fails to clairify assignment expecations properly. Essay criticism is at times contradictory.

Professor O'Brien is a very interesting, funny, highly intelligent and challenging prof. Her seminars are great. My only problem was that she lets bull****ters get away with too much, and was overly accepting of flawed ideas - but you can't really criticize someone for being too nice. I learned a whole lot, and she's open about research topics.
hard marker but good enthusiasm
Was the most interesting class and professor in SFU. Her marking was tough but her passion for teaching and small class sizes make up for it.

Really good professor. Wasn't an easy course- there was a lot, a lot of readings, and needed to be very prepared for discussion, but an excellant prof still. Very helpful at guiding discussion and fair marking.
Best History Prof! Interesting and concise. Her lectures were always interesting and organised. Outlines and tutorial questions emailed early too. Very approachable and kind.

Very nice and really interested in her subject, lectures were great but sometimes she can go a little fast and its hard to write down everything. Marking was fine, Tutorial was really good, the readings sometimes were dry but then she made them interesting in some way. Overall excellent prof, really approachalbe too and very nice.

What a wonderful human being! She is a fabulous speaking, extremely captivating. Gives a lot of work and some readings are a bit dry, but all together a great professor and very knowlegable and nice. As for the hot factor, I suppose she would befairly good looking- if I were a guy:)
She's a great prof! She's obviously passionate about her subject area and she's so much fun in class! Marking's a little tough, but fair.
Great prof! She really cares about students and made the subject very interesting. One of the best profs I've had in university. I highly recommend her.

She is by far the best teacher I've had in the history department since beginning at SFU. She loves her subject and it shows in her lectures and tutorials. Take her for sure if you have the chance. Plus, the marking isn't too too bad!
